prefix.description: Allows setting and clearing the server specific prefix. Requires **Manage Server** permission.

args.Subcommand:
"Set:" Sets the prefix.
"Clear": Sets the prefix back to default.
args.Prefix: Prefix, which will be set for the server. Can't contain spaces.

help.description: Helps you use the bot. Duh.

args.Command: Command to get the help information from.

feedback.description: Sends feedback to the developer server.

args.Feedback: Feedback that's left, can only be text.

args.Server ID:
The ID of the server, from which the bot will leave.
Empty to leave the current server.

setavatar.description: Changes the avatar of the bot.

activity.description: Sets the activity of the bot

args.Name: Text, which will be shown on the status.

setname.description: Changes the name of the bot.

args.Name: The new name of the bot.

color.description:
Sets your color to a specified hex value or opens a helper menu.
Without arguments, removes the current color.

args.Hex: A hex color. Choose your favorite color from https://htmlcolorcodes.com/color-picker/
args.\"Avatar\": Opens a menu with color suggestions based on your current avatar.
args.\"Random\": Opens a menu with random color suggestions.

args.Subcommand:
"Set": Requires name and content. Create's a new tag you can use on any server.
"Remove": Requires name, removes tag you've created.
"List": lists all tags you've created.
args.Name: Name of the tag. Used to call the tags you've created.
args.Content: Content shown when tag has been run. Can include text and an image.

quote.description: Gets a message from the same channel with ID or a saved message from the server.

args.Subcommand:
Either a message id, saved quote name or follow subcommand:
"set": Saves a quote for use later. Allows for the quote to be called from any channel (NSFW limitations exist). Requires message id and name.
"Remove": Removes a saved quote. You must be the creator of the tag or must have **Manage Messages** permission to remove quotes. Requires name.
"List": Lists all quotes on the server.
args.Message ID: Id of the message you want to quote.
args.Name: Name of the saved quote.
